newsitem.title: USA: American pilots' discontent over pact terms - WSJ.
newsitem.headline: American pilots' discontent over pact terms - WSJ.

text.p: The terms of tentative contract between American Airlines and its pilots are generating opposition among certain pilot groups, the Wall Street Journal said in Friday's electronic edition.
The paper said a group which threw a previous tentative pact off course, APA Pilots Defending the Profession, was planning its first strategy in weeks.
"I think there's going to be a backlash," the paper quoted Robert Held, a pilot and an active member of the group, as saying. "Guys view this as an unnecessary sellout."
Union leaders said members remained concerned about letting the airline use junior pilots to fly regional jets on its commuter lines, the paper said.
"There's going to a firestorm," a union board member was quoted as saying.
American Airlines is a unit of AMR Corp.
